Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red pottery vessel, the fabric is predominantly black in section, the interior is slightly grooved and thickly covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is painted buff with a red-brown band, a mauve band and squiggle, remains of five lines of Coptic text written in black ink also survive.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393344) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393344)
